meaningMnemonic:
We're going to <kanji>deal with</kanji> it by <kanji>put</kanji>ting this up your butt and giving you the <vocabulary>treatment</vocabulary> you need. Kancho!

処置 is commonly used when treating injuries or illnesses. It can also refer to deciding how to handle a situation or the act of handling it, but in these cases, people usually use 処理 instead.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
